abstract: New York State Supreme Court Justice Eduardo Padro hears closing arguments in case for new trial of Johnny Hincapie, who has served 20 years in prison for 1990 mugging and murder of Brian Watkins; decision will hinge largely on testimony of witness Mariluz Santana, who did not come forward at time of original trial but now says Hincapie was not present during crime.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Hincapie was one of seven young men convicted in the 1990 stabbing death of Brian Watkins, whose killing galvanized public outrage over violent crime in New York.

headline.main: Case for New Trial for Johnny Hincapie in Subway Murder Centers on Witnesses
headline.print_headline: Case for a New Trial in ’90 Subway Murder Centers on Witnesses’ Testimony

snippet: Mr. Hincapie was one of seven young men convicted in the 1990 stabbing death of Brian Watkins, whose killing galvanized public outrage over violent crime in New York.
